text: The Elmore County Courthouse is a historic building in Mountain Home, Idaho, and the courthouse of Elmore County, Idaho. With It was built in 1916 by C. E. Johnson with sandstone from Boise, and it was designed in the Classical Revival style by Wayland and Fennel. The construction was completed 17 years after the establishment of Elmore County. It has been listed on the National Register of Historic Places since September 22, 1987. ==References== Category:Courthouses on the National Register of Historic Places in Idaho Category:National Register of Historic Places in Elmore County, Idaho Category:Neoclassical architecture in Idaho Category:Government buildings completed in 1916
title: Elmore County Courthouse (Idaho)
